section.title: will for offers and instant decisions
section.sectiontitle: We use will + verb when we make a decision at the moment of speaking. Very often we use it to make offers. We always use the short form 'll.
section.text1a: I feel tired. I think I'll stay in tonight.
section.text2a: Don't worry. I'll take you in my car.
section.sectiontitle2:
We don't use will when we have already decided to do something. We usually use
the Present continuous or going to + verb.
section.text3: I've already arranged to meet Phil tonight.
section.text4: We've already decided to get married.
